alert.note: Alert for Vernon (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lake Charles (Southeast Texas and Southwest Louisiana)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 27 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Lake Charles
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Vernon Parish in west central Louisiana and northeastern Newton Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 100 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Burr Ferry, or 8 miles south of Toledo Bend Dam, moving east at 55 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Leesville, Toledo Bend Dam, Fort Polk, New Llano and Burr Ferry. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 500 AM CDT for west central Louisiana...and southeastern Texas.
